Posts.Content: IndianaMomOf3 wrote: I am exhausted but afraid to go to sleep.  I have tried taking a nap twice today with no success.  I have only put my Suduko book down twice for fear of where my mind would go.  I will be taking my children like it is a normal, every day thing, and then head off to the US.  At some point tomarrow I will also be getting my Prolactin level results.  This is sensory overload for me and I really don't know how to handle it.  My Aunt is is driving me there and a cousin is meeting us there, for moral support.  I don't want to even leave the house.  I thought it would help having these important people with me, but I don't want to see anyone now.  I don't know how to feel about Prolactin levels and how much weight they should carry in a BC DX.  There are so many different opinions on the subject.  I have had many US before but never for my breasts and the fact that I am a very PRIVATE person when it comes to my "girls", having to lay on a table for a period of time so someone can scan them really makes me uncomfortable. How long will the scan last?  Being that exposed for any period of time is  like torture for me.   How do I handle this?  I am just about at my max.  I sat in the school's pick up line today and cried.  I felt like a fool.  I just want to know if it is or if it isn't.  I truely believe that knowing either way will make things so much easier to go forward from, but how do I know when they have done enough to rule out C all together?  Sorry for the ranting, just needed to get it out there. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: US tomarrow morning - scared IndianaMomOf3 adgra

Posts.Content: IndianaMomOf3 wrote: Hello Ladies, Well, I call Monday to see if I will have Ductography or an Excision.  Surgeon just said that the US was negative and prolactin was normal.  I honostly think he would have left it at that if I wouldn't have been so pro-active.  I asked him why I had a couple "really big ducts" and all he could say was good question.  Possibley a pappiloma.  When I told him I was not satisfied until I had a 100% answer, he seemed pleased.  Once he understood that I would go through whatever I needed to to get that answer, surgery and all, he said o.k. (with an approving smile), call on monday for scheduling.  I think too many woman are passive when it comes to trusting doctors.  I couldn't even imagine taking the "wait and see" approach.  He flat out told me, when I asked, that it is possible for there to be something there that a mammo and US missed.  So, spread the word Ladies!  Be proactive, take charge of your well being, educate yourself and your friends and family.  Don't stop looking until you are given a 100% dx.  A YES or NO, not a "it's probably ok."  because women have had "a very slim chance" dx and then it was.  Even if it is only a 2% chance of anything,  obviously it happened to that 2%.  OK, enough ranting.  My middle child had friends stay over for his 11th bday last night, and I think they have found a new room to destroy.  lol  I need to go. I have never met any of you, that I know of, but I love you all.  A room has been built in my heart to hold each of you there, and only you know the password. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Update... IndianaMomOf3 IndianaMomOf3

Posts.Content: IndianaMomOf3 wrote: Good Afternoon Ladies, I FINALLY have my US scheduled for Friday, but tomarrow I have blood drawn to check Prolactin Level.  So, what role does this play in my dx and how reliable are the results if physical and emotional stress can increase the levels?  Of course I am stressed, who wouldn't be when after 4 years of being told that the green discharge is no big deal to "there is blood in the green discharge"?  Is this a fasting test?  No one told me if it was, just go tomorrow to get the blood drawn.  I read an article that prolactin does contribute to BC and can make it more aggressive.  Does anyone know if this is true?  I feel so un-educated and un-informed, so I am turning to who I trust, which right now are the women on THIS board.  Any information would be helpful.  Thank you Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: What does Prolactin have to do with it? IndianaMomOf3 leaf

Posts.Content: IndianaMomOf3 wrote: I am a 38yo mother of 3.  My mother, at age 52, was diagnosed with stageIV BC, and had 21/23 lymph nodes affected.  So, I rcvd my first mamogram at age 25.  I gave birth to my 3rd and final child in Feb. of 2003.  After a year, my breasts dried up.    About 3 years later, I noticed a tinted discharge from my right nipple.  Just figured it was a normal woman thing.  After another year or so, noticed the discharge again, only this time it was a dark, "Army colored" green.  At my next mamo I asked the Dr and she said was totally normal and not to worry about it.  I may have it the rest of my life, don't worry.  So, I didn't.  Well,  being the naive person I can be, went on with my life.  Last month I got another mamogram.  Had to go back for a "diagnosis" mamogram to be told that it was just overlying tissue.  OK, I have dense breasts so I can see that, but they wanted me to see a specialist for the discharge.  So, my appointment was yesterday and that is when I find out that if blood is found in said discharge, I need further tests.  IT'S DARK GREEN, HOW AM I TO KNOW IF BLOOD IS INVOLVED???  Why hasn't anyone before now cultured the discharge and check for it?  Well, now I have this going on in both nipples, multiple spots on both nipples also, and the Dr found blood.   UGH!  So, now I have to wait until Monday to get an ultrasound scheduled.  I just got past the waiting game between my first and second mamograms, that was over a week.  Was over joyed with results and now someone blew up my happy bubble and I am even more worried.  So,  God blessed me with a Dr that knew to test the discharge for blood, but now I feel paralized with fear.  People say "don't worry until there is something to worry about", "it will be ok", "just keep busy", "chin up".  WTH???  Really???  I am an extremely passive person, but I want to punch them in the noggin.  I can actually visualize it, lol.   So, that is my story thus far.  (sorry for the spelling, was never my strong subject) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Happy Bubble Popped: Blood in Nipple Discharge IndianaMomOf3 lwarstler
